result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharkyla C Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED.

If sentence is ordered served, huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant.

miscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
